New Records: Georgian player Georges Mikautadze became the first to score in all three group-stage games at Euro 2024
Mikautadze joined an exclusive list of eight players to have scored in all of their side's group-stage games in major tournaments
Key Match Events: Kvaratskhelia scored the fastest goal in the match after just 93 seconds
Georgia scored two goals to win 2-0 against Portugal, marking a historic upset
Cristiano Ronaldo failed to score a group-stage goal at a major tournament for the first time in his career
Post-Match Reflections: Kvaratskhelia received UEFA's Player of the Match award for his performance
Georgia's victory over Portugal is considered the biggest upset in Euro 2024
Georgia will face Spain in the last 16, while Portugal will play Slovenia
Miscellaneous Highlights: Georgia had just 28% possession, the lowest by a winning team at the European Championship since 1980
Portugal secured top spot in Group F with six points before the match
Georgian goalkeeper Mamardashvili made a crucial save from Semedo
